title: Riot Mystery Skin?
body: Well, I just got gifted a mystery skin from Riot? I was like what? It say ive been good to the community or something but I'm so grateful and I think it is really good Riot is doing this as I believe it will make the community a better place? Am I the only one that has experienced this? Post thoughts

Why the hell was this post downvoted?

I think positive re-enforcement is a much better solution then negative,
people who get bans and leaver buster stuff and all that, it just makes them angrier and care even less about AFKing or cursing and stuff
but everyone likes getting gifts and no one wants to miss the chance to get one.
so i am really happy riot has done this.

Well according to the data the higher majority of players who get a ban or Leaver Buster punishment actually reform. It's something like 70-80% improve their actions while only 20-30% get worse or don't change at all.


Besides I've already given speeches and crap in other threads about negative versus positive reinforcement in terms of an anonymous community with references to actual psychological studies that proved only negative reinforcement should ever be used as the main method for reform.

The end result isn't really what I'm talking about, its the mentality, you might get less results with just positive re-enforcemnt but people just feel happier all-round, besides its just a game, its not worth reforming the worlds population over, if someone leaves a game thats tough luck, its a game, it should be put in perspective, the main object is fun and no one has fun when everyone gets punished harshly over small things, a lot of which were out of their control.

Only a small extreme is out of their control. You only think it's a lot because THEY ARE THE ONLY ONES WHO COMPLAIN ON THE FORUMS!

People who are actually in the wrong don't come onto social media and complain, because they know they did wrong. That's why what you think is so %%%%ing completely from the truth of the matter.

Stop with the %%%%ing bleeding heart mentality and actually look at how the real world works and how psychology actually works.
Nothing should be based off your fantasy view of the world you have.

Jeez whats with the rage?? 
it is my personal opinion that because it is an online game that people come to for enjoyment, that the punishments are too brutal.
and I'm not talking about the forums, from my own personal experience from playing lol 80% of the people that DC from games i am in DC for reasons out of their control and 60% of those people re-connect halfway through the game, i don't know what you have experienced and given your rage you have lost credibility so i wouldn't believe any statistic you gave anyway.

I dont care how psychology works in the real world because this isn't the real world, it is a world people go to, to escape the real world and enjoy themselves, you can trust me, the world i live in is far from this 'fantasy' you mention, and anyway in a fake world where people come to enjoy themselves, fun should be the main concern, not worry about losing your hard earned account, or anger that someone left your game, incase you hadn't noticed a 4v5 is very winnable i have even won quite a few 3v5s and the worst thing that can possibly happen is that you lose a game, not an arm or a leg but a game, a few pixels that portrey something that never even existed. I'm not the kind of guy to get annoyed about losing, you obviously are, so its natural that our opinions are different.

i dont mind a AFKer or two every few games, it makes the game more challenging win or gives you an excuse to not blame your %%%%ty playing when you lose, if i can play a game as one of my favourite champs with a friend or even alone then thats me happy, if i lose it doesn't matter, if i win its great, ranked is a bit different, i do get slightly annoyed if someone leaves a ranked game, because (at least in the lol world) ranked matters, so my opinion is that leaver buster should red-flag you or whatever for leaving normal games but only punish you for it when you play ranked, its not a perfect solution but its the one i believe is right, 

i don't care if it isn't the most efficient way of reforming the world, just walk down any major street in the world and you'll see 
weed-soaked filth just lying in the street or kids drinking and throwing up everywhere graffiting shops and houses that people have worked hard to maintain and you'll just accept that much of humanity cant be re-formed. You can make the world slightly better for everyone, or make it a lot better for just the people who care about it, we cant solve the AFKing problem because people do have lives out there that are more important than some pixels on a screen, but we can make life better for those who don't AFK by rewarding them for not doing it.

thats my opinion, you don't have to like it but you don't have to rage at it just because it doesn't match yours either

I "rage" at your opinion because IT IS WRONG. I've proven it's wrong, I've encouraged you to go and read multiple studies on WHY YOU ARE WRONG, but you keep refusing to accept the facts of reality and the human brain.

Hell I'd just directly link some of the studies but I'm pretty %%%%ing sure you will just refuse to read them, because you can't accept that you are wrong.

I dont care about being right or wrong, nothing i have said is fact, its all opinion so there is no right or wrong anyway.
i agree that your way is more effective for reducing the AFKers i never said i didn't.
my whole point was that i don't believe an online game should be policed so harshly.
thats not a fact that is right or wrong its just what i think, you are welcome to disagree with it if you want but that doesn't make a difference to what i think.
